greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Completely multiplicative with a(prime(k)) = prime(2 * k) (where prime(k) denotes the k-th prime).
comment: This sequence is a permutation of {1} union A066207.
This sequence is the third row of A248601.
link: Rémy Sigrist, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = A248601(3, n) for any n > 0.
mathematica: Array[Times @@ Map[Power @@ # &, FactorInteger[#] /. {p_, e_} /; p > 1 :> {Prime[2 PrimePi@ p], e}] &, 57] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 23 2017 *)
results.author: _Rémy Sigrist_, Dec 23 2017
